Package elements

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
elements.Camera
public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
Class Camera represent view of the geometric world through the view plane (which represent the picture), Through the view plane the camera captures the geometric world. it produces graphic views of the objects using the view plane and rays and object intersections. The rays converge according to the location of the pixel centers in the view plane. directions of the camera to the right, up and front (compared to the original x,y,z axis), all vectors orthogonal to each other

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Camera​(Point3D p0, Vector Vto, Vector Vup)
    simple Camera constructor which get as input location point and two orthogonal vectors represent the direction

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      this function gets the view plane size and a selected pixel, and return the ray from the camera which intersects this pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - - amount of rows in view plane (number of pixels)
      nY - - amount of columns in view plane (number of pixels)
      j - - X's index
      i - - Y's index
      Returns:
      - the ray which goes through the pixel

    • constructRaysThroughPixel

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructRaysThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      this function gets the view plane size and a selected pixel, and return the rays from the view plane which intersects the focal plane
      Parameters:
      nX - - amount of columns in view plane (number of pixels)
      nY - - amount of rows in view plane (number of pixels)
      j - - X's index
      i - - Y's index
      Returns:
      - the list of rays which goes from the pixel through the focal plane
